item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NBA investigates alleged Sterling racist talk
item.description: An audio recording purportedly of Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling making racist remarks to his girlfriend is being investigated by the National Basketball Association.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: FSU's Winston cited for shoplifting crab legs
item.description: Florida State quarterback and reigning Heisman Trophy winner Jameis Winston received a civil citation after he was accused of taking crab legs and crawfish from a supermarket.

item.dc:creator: Michael Wallace
item.title: LeBron on Sterling: 'We need to get him out'
item.description: LeBron James is demanding NBA owners follow up on commissioner Adam Silver's lifetime ban against Donald Sterling by voting to force the league's longest-tenured owner to sell the Los Angeles Clippers.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Kings owner eyes 29-0 vote against Sterling
item.description: Sacramento Kings owner Vivek Ranadive anticipates that his fellow NBA owners will vote unanimously to force Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Sen. urges NFL to follow NBA, end 'Redskins'
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid says it's time for NFL commissioner Roger Goodell to follow NBA counterpart Adam Silver's lead and rid his "league of bigotry and racism" by forcing the Washington Redskins to change their nickname.

item.dc:creator: Paul Biancardi
item.title: No. 2 hoops recruit Turner will attend Texas
item.description: Myles Turner, the No. 2 player in the ESPN 100, chose in-state Texas Longhorns on Wednesday over the likes of Kansas, Oklahoma State and Duke.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Oprah among group mulling bid on Clippers
item.description: Oprah Winfrey, David Geffen and Larry Ellison are joining together to make a bid to buy the Los Angeles Clippers if the NBA's board of governors votes to force Donald Sterling to sell the team, Geffen told ESPN's Jeremy Schaap on Wednesday.

item.dc:creator: Darren Rovell
item.title: Blazers to honor Ramsay with jersey patch
item.description: The Portland Trail Blazers will honor the memory of former coach Dr. Jack Ramsay with a patch on their jerseys, beginning Wednesday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Trump to buy course that's hosted British Open
item.description: Donald Trump has agreed to buy Turnberry Resort in Scotland, famous for its Ailsa Course that has hosted the Open Championship four times.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Keenan first to win Stanley Cup, KHL title
item.description: In his first year as the head coach of Russian team Metallurg Magnitogorsk, 63-year-old Mike Keenan won the Kontinental Hockey League championship Wednesday. Keenan is now the first coach to win both the Stanley Cup and the KHL championship.

item.dc:creator: Bob Harig
item.title: Rory outside top 10 for first time in 3 years
item.description: For the first time in more than three years, Rory McIlroy has dropped out of the ranking of the top 10 golfers in the world.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Sources: Clips' Crawford wins 6th Man Award
item.description: Los Angeles Clippers guard Jamal Crawford has won the NBA's Sixth Man Award for the second time in his career, according to sources familiar with the voting.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Filing: Franklin contacted Vandy case victim
item.description: A new defense filing in the case involving rape charges against four former Vanderbilt players claims that current Penn State coach James Franklin contacted the alleged victim shortly after the incident.

item.dc:creator: Pat McManamon
item.title: No Hitner: Whitner not changing last name
item.description: There will be no Donte Hitner in the NFL.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Wiz best Bulls for first series win since 2005
item.description: John Wall finished with 24 points, Nene scored 20, and the Washington Wizards beat the Chicago Bulls 75-69 on Tuesday night to clinch their first-round series in five games.
